outputs.output_descr:
1)  UNDP practitioners and anti-corruption officials are trained on anti-corruption and ethics.
2) Six UNCAC gap analyses are conducted and the results are reported to the review mechanism meeting and other relevant fora.
3) The knowledge is shared and anti-corruption capacities are built through a virtual network.
4) The studies are conducted on mainstreaming/integrating anti-corruption in service delivery. The studies are shared in the 14th IACC.

1)  Advisory services are provided in Francophone countries and mapping of AC initiatives conducted through a AC specialist based in Dakar.
2)  The first AC CoP meeting for west and central Africa organized and AC COP members trained in programming.
3)  CSOs from francophone countries trained on anti-corruption.
4) Working closely with RBA and WBI, a high level policy dialogue is organized for Francophone Africa.

1)   3 capacity assessment missions conducted and at least one regional cooperation and knowledge/staff exchange event organized.
2) A Toolkit for COs on supporting Anti-Corruption Agencies is completed and translated in Russian.
3)  The Anti-Corruption Practitioner's Network (ACPN) is supported so that it continued serving the region by providing information and support.
4)  Data on corruption patterns and vulnerabilities in Central Asian countries are gathered and analyzed.

1)  The first AC CoP meeting for eastern and southern Africa organized and AC COP members trainined in programming.
2) Selected anti-corruption agencies from Africa region are trained on prevention.
3)  At least 20 journalists are trained in investigating and reporting corruption.
4)  A research on contextualization of corruption in Africa conducted.

1) Two innovative projects on anti-corruption and local accountability (one regional and one country level) are supported and their outputs and outcomes are shared to other regions.
2) At least 25 AC CoP members from LAC region are trained on AC programming.
3) The Anti-Corruption and Human Development course in Spanish is finalized by conducting a peer review. The module is translated in English and the course is rolled out.

1) The technical backstopping and inputs are provided through experts/trainers for the capacity development of anti-corruption institutions.
2) Regional specific knowledge products/research papers are conducted on one or more of the following sectors  produced: (i) health; (ii) water; (iii) education; and (iv) energy.
3) The members of regional AC COP members are trained on mainstreaming anti-corruption in development and the Arab Anti-Corruption & Integrity Network (ACINET) continue receiving PACDE's technical support.
